Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Limited Pool Hours”
Reviews.Author: cow_manx
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel but the location isn't the best. If parking in downtown Seattle was easier this wouldn't be an issue but the walk from downtown to the hotel is uphill at an incline. The service is fantastic but the pool is only open for 6 hours each day from 4pm-10pm. Free candy in the lobby. You need to use your key card to take the elevator to the floors with rooms so it's very secure.

Reviews.Title: “If visiting Seattle university, the best location.”
Reviews.Author: mmandavis
Reviews.Content: I was visiting SU's open house with my daughter to decide on college. It is literally across the street from campus. The hotel is not luxurious, but what makes up for that is the value. You can tend to business at SU and then take advantage of the free shuttle service provided by the hotel to at least 4 points of interest in the downtown area. It runs until 10pm and all that is required is a phone call for a return trip. We had a rental but was so grateful to not have to drive in the downtown area with parking not cheap and dealing with traffic. The rooms were clean and bathroom adequate. The staff was very friendly. There is a restaurant on site with a bar . We stayed in a room facing Madison where there is noise but not as loud as staying near broadway. The breakfast is overpriced so I would recommend the ihop just behind the hotel for which is just as good but half the price. If visiting SU I would stay here again otherwise I would stay downtown where all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Super8Langley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February for a weekend getaway. We had booked via Hotwire which was an amazing rate considering the tier of hotel this is. Silver Cloud Hotel has very nice staff as well as the shuttle driver who was very helpful in guiding us around the downtown area. Jimmy's wasn't very busy but it should be, the food was great and they had a wide variety of beers on tap. Not far from downtown at all and if you choose not to use the complimentary shuttle, cab rides are no more than $7.00-$8.00 to get to major attractions downtown. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Always reliable Silver Cloud!”
Reviews.Author: stevenr35
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff on check in. Really great. Organised my wake up call and town car efficiently. Room was a little tired but had everything you need. Good TV, coffee maker in the room (unlike the W), free wifi, nice little bar/restaurant. Very good location. Would definitely stay here again. Usually stay at Lake Union but I prefer this location.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Hotel - Broadway”
Reviews.Author: ianlangley
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire, Rooms were excellent for the price. Location is slightly away from main hotels (3-4 blocks). But this is compensated by a free courtesy bus leaving on the half hour to various locations. The adjoining restaurant "Jimmys" has excellect food (went 3 times in the 4 days there, with not a bad meal in sight). Would Recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great design!”
Reviews.Author: pederpod
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Secure parking is located conveniently below the building, though they charge $20 for it. Lobby is spacious and staff was courteous. Room is very large, immaculate, and beds very comfortable. Shower is excellent- water will heat up (very hot) fast and there's great pressure. Rooms have a built in kitchenette, which was fantastic. Includes sink, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. Water tasted very good as well. Another interesting feature of the hotel to point out is that it's a "Green" hotel and the heating appears to be geothermal (Water Furnace). Great experience with my wife and young daughter- no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location near downtown, sterile rooms and building”
Reviews.Author: MrsDDO
Reviews.Content: I didn't feel like I could enjoy any public area of this hotel, and it was all so institutional and sterile. The pool and fitness center both were closed down, first one, and then both, although I'd called earlier to ask. One must walk a bit to enjoy the best this neighborhood has to offer; fun and funky with pie and espresso and french food too. Has a great free shuttle service that helps makes it a great location. The use of the "gate card" throughout adds to the institution feel. I didn't figure out how to work the heater. I liked the towels. It goes on like this -- back and forth with the experience, but in the end it isn't a warm, fun place and is just a place to sleep, so it might as well be one star less and a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Kenny S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Silver Cloud on Broadway many times in the last four years. My son went to S.U. right across the street and it was very convenient. The rooms were always nice and clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the onsite restaurant is pretty good. The only thing I don't like is the parking, it's hard to get a truck into the tight garage and I really don't think hotels should charge for parking. If you need to stay in this part of town and you're not expecting the Four Seasons, I think you should be happy. I think the rates are competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: alaskan64
Reviews.Content: I got this place through hotwire it was worth every penny that i paid for it. the only problem was that the pool and the hot tub area was being remodeled the same week i was there. the room is very big and comfortable real nice bed th e resting for the night was real nice. it is a very short walk to downtown are which is a nice walk... one other thing since i booked it through hotwire and was checking in early i had to pay half a day fee for the room extra.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for the Broadway side of town.”
Reviews.Author: HarryR_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last September whilst visiting relatives living on this side of town and found it very satisfactory indeed. It is well located for the Broadway part of the city with lots of good restaurants in the vicinity(Quinns on Pike) including some nice cheap eating places for lunch nearby as well as a QFC over the road. Rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet (at the back) and well serviced. Would definitely reccommend if looking tostay on this side of I5.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud came to our rescue in the snowstorm”
Reviews.Author: kinshasa
Reviews.Content: Two flights I had booked both cancelled Thursday of the big snowstorm. Every hotel around the airport was full. The ones farther away had rooms but no electricity. I had a ticket for a Friday afternoon flight so another stranded traveler and I called around to find a hotel for the night. We needed two beds and Silver Cloud gave us a top floor suite and a comfortable pull-out sofa bed, then took $20 off the quoted price. The next morning we took their "limousine" to the airport with another hotel guest. The charge was $50 for all three of us. (The taxi the night before cost the two of us $35 EACH--- double the fare -- as the taxi drivers fleeced everyone) Silver Cloud went out of their way to accommodate us in a tense and exhausting situation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service & Comfort--had it all!”
Reviews.Author: summerlove
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at the Silver Cloud. Not only was it immaculate and clean, the rooms were larger than most. The beds were comfortable and the location was idea. There was a free shuttle to the downtown, and the front desk staff was helpful and pleasant. When we are in Seattle again, we most likely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right outside downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to celebrate our anniversary. While the hotel decor and amenities are nothing too special, the rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. We were very happy with our stay for the price we paid. Also, we used the shuttle 5 or 6 times in two days... it was very prompt and the drivers were very friendly. They even picked us up at the market and took us to the Underground Tour location. Saved us a lot of headache from trying to find parking! I would definitely recommend this hotel and would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I would expect”
Reviews.Author: Edweber7
Reviews.Content: Nothing stood out as really good or bad. The room was as expected the people upfront were helpful. The hottub could have been cleaner with hopefully less chemicals. If the price was lower would rate it higher but for the price we paid it met expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Treated our family with kindness, respect and graciousness.”
Reviews.Author: Tajthetink
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying at the Silver Cloud Inn on Broadway for almost two weeks now due to it's proximity to Swedish Medical Center where my dad is in ICU. I cannot rave enough about our experience here. From the front desk staff, the housekeepers, the shuttle drivers and the entire crew at Jimmy's they have been amazing. Their care and genuine hospitality have meant so much to my family. From placing our rooms close together on the same floor, accommodating for very late night/early morning check-in's for our large family without reservations, and for Jimmy's for extending so many requests, kind, positive words and seating our large groups several times a day. The beautiful part was that they all made it seem so effortless even during this busy Holiday season. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean, safe, comfortable place to stay in the Downtown, Broadway, First Hill areas of Seattle no matter the reason for your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Softball_nut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while attending a Seahawks game. Great price through Hotwire not as close to downtown as we would of liked but the free shuttle was easy to use and quick. You need to book ahead however, especially for a football game. We waited until after breakfast, IHOP right beside, and the shuttles were all full. Only a $7 taxi ride to the stadium so no biggie. Parking will cost $16/day, kinda pricey when there is an $8/day lot right next door. Not the greatest neighborhood, safe enough, just not much around for shopping or nightlife. Rooms were large and very clean and quiet. Free wi-fi, fridge and microwave, Aveda care products. On site restaurant, Jimmy's, had a decent happy hour, try the cone of fries. Would stay again and would try their other locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jam18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of its close proximity to Swedish Hospital - 2 block walking distance. Room was clean, comfortable bed and pillows. room comes with a little fridge and a microwave, Aveda care products, free newspapers, free wi-fi. No room safe though. In the lobby they have a nice open sitting area, a little convenience item retail area and a business center with 2 computers and 1 printer. Took out a meal from Jimmy's, sandwiches and burgers both with fries, very good and the portions were nice size. secure parking underground, $16.00 per night with in and out privileges. Didn't try the shuttle which went downtown, but saw it running people often. A block away is Bartell Drugs and a QFC grocery store. We did try a Vietnamese Restaurant "Tangerine Tree" by Bartell's, very good and reasonable. I must say that all the front desk staff here are excellent. Personable & helpful, made the stay a pleasure and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy, very comfy, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Jotravy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel experience. Nice staff to great, great restaurant with very well priced happy hour. Rooms were huge and quiet relative to many Seattle hotels I stayed at. Very comfortable beds, huge clean rooms, big tv. Shuttle service was awesome. Dropped us in heart of city right up till ten thirty. And picked us up til that time also

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not yet great”
Reviews.Author: RIDPDX
Reviews.Content: Good location, with shuttle service that makes all the difference compared to a hotel downtown. Sadly the second half of my stay was marred by inconsistent shuttle service and misinformation about the shuttle schedule. would have been 4 stars but for this. Otherwise staff is courteous and helpful. Jimmy's restaurant next door is pretty good. The pizzetta is essentially a good sized pizza - good for 2, and cheap during happy hour. Wine selection is solo, but the house red is actually good, and also a steal during happy hour. Supermarket is close by to grab breakfast food. Shuttle made the car mostly redundant. But be prepared for random deviations to the shuttle schedule. Didn't get to use the fitness facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Hotel exceeded my expectations. Employee seem happy. Shuttle service was great.”
Reviews.Author: joefun619
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a recent conference. Hotel and staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “everything's perfect - location, service, room, amenities”
Reviews.Author: adtripvizor
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel --- low profile 6 story hotel on capitol hill --- walking distance to restaurants, bars, shopping and interesting neighborhoods. The service is fantastic. Room is very clean with operable double-pane windows, frij/microwave wet bar, comfy bed, huge TV, Aveda products. The indoor pool is refreshing. There's a shuttle to/from local attractions. Hotel is about 1 mile from the airport light rail --- you can arrange for shuttle pickup.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinyunclebuck
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting in Seattle in late July, and wanted to spend a few days beforehand exploring Seattle. I had never heard of this hotel before and decided to try it out after reading the reviews. Best decision I made! Loved everything about this hotel. The free shuttle picked me up within 5 minutes of calling from downtown, Jimmy's on Broadway had an excellent Happy Hour late at night, the Hot Tub was welcomed after a long day of exploring, and it was nice having FREE laundry for guests! I wish this Hotel Chain was nationwide and I will definitely book this hotel again when I return to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a relaxing, budget-friendly stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeni Q
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Seattle for our 1 year anniversary (and our first time away from our son). We wanted a relaxing stay, and ended up choosing Silver Cloud on Boardway because it had an indoor pool that we wanted to take advantage of and had very competitive prices. The stay was AMAZING! The COMPLIMENTARY Shuttle (although I would strongly encourage tipping them, it was frustrating to see not many guests did) picked us up at the train station 4 hours before our official check-in time, and we were able to spend a little time in the hotel restaurant Jimmy's before our room was ready. The entire trip we did not have to wait for ANYTHING. We called for a shuttle, and it was there (and has very convenient drop-off and pick-up spots at main attractions in town), we ordered room service, and it was there within 20 minutes. The bed was AMAZING, the view was awesome, and the neighborhood was very clean. It's by many of the schools, and the neighborhood was not "scary" by any means and within walking distance to several hospitals, and only about 9 blocks away from "Westlake" for shopping and "Pikes Place". We will definitely stay there again. It had everything it needed to have....and for a pretty awesome price (at about $90/night)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dillon178
Reviews.Content: My wife booked our hotel stay for downtown Seattle on Priceline. When she told me we got "Silver Cloud Hotel on Broadway" the first thing I thought is I've never heard of it I'm sure it's going to be terrible. Luckily for me I was totally wrong. While the hotel is very much on the edge of downtown, they more than make up with that by running a free shuttle leaving the hotel every 30 min and will pick you when you call. it was awesome, that alone made the hotel a great place to stay. However, there is more. The hotel restaurant and bar "Jimmy's" is great. They offered 2 happy hours including a late night happy hour from 9-11pm with cheap appetizers and drinks. we ordered a few appetizers and thew the leftovers in the fridge in our room. The next night when we got back late and moderately drunk and hungry we just threw our leftovers into the microwave and had a small feast in the room. All around it was a great stay. It was, clean, comfortable, spacious rooms, helpful and courteous staff. i was truley impressed and would most definately recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Seattle on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view ... of Swedish First Hill”
Reviews.Author: ZWoman92
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to its proximity to Swedish First Hill Medical Center and booked it through AARP Travel. Called the hotel before my departure to see if they had shuttle service from Sea-Tac airport. Initially, I was disappointed that they did not - but they explained that I could take the light rail from the airport to the Westlake Station and they had a pick up point at Westlake Plaza. The staff were wonderful, able to get me an early check in and late check out, and the room (2 queen beds) was clean. The free shuttle was very accommodating - didn't need a car, was able to get everywhere I needed to get to. Had some issue with the tub draining on the first morning, but by the time I returned late afternoon, it had been addressed and fixed! Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, a Massage Envy a short drive away, and a short walk to Swedish First Hill. Enjoyed having the mini refrigerator and wet bar. Service at Jimmy's wasn't so great. I would definitely stay here again in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping well in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithlabs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Cloud on Broadway for five nights, and never had a bad night's sleep or unpleasant experience. Since I was sharing a room, we booked a room with two queen beds. The room was very spacious which made it easy for sharing, as did a second sink in the room. We had a large bow window that added some floor space, light and was a nice detail. The amenities in the room were great! A mini-fridge, micro wave, coffee maker and small kitchen style sink made it feel like we had a kitchenette! The room was stocked with real glasses and china mugs, which always counts for something with me! The only thing I would change about the room is the bed cover. It is a traditional hotel quilt, heavy brocade, that obviously is not washed between guests. This always bothers me, as I have seen an expose' on possible sources of germs in hotel rooms and what can be found on bed covers is pretty bad! I prefer to see a white duvet covered with sheets for extra sanitation measures. The Silver Cloud staff were very service-oriented. They made sure to tell me about their towncar service when I booked the room. They offered to book this service to meet me at the airport and bring me back, which saved $30 round trip, over a taxi fare. The location is fine, near a college campus, and with a wonderful, full service market one block away, if you want to bring food, wine or the like, back to your room. You can walk to Pike's Place Market in about 20 minutes, but be prepared for some hilly terrain! The free hotel shuttle will take you to this area also. The hotel bar is not your typical, depressing, quiet retreat for hotel guests! It is obviously a favorite spot for locals who work in the area. The place is hopping during nightly happy hour and they have an excellent selection of draft beers, domestic, microbrew, and import for $3.50 to $4.00 a pint during happy hour. The Siver Cloud Chain deserves extra praise for the way they handled a situation I had. I booked a block of rooms for course at a nearby hospital, at an another Silver Cloud in Seattle, and then found out that the hotel was not the closest to the meeting site, and would not offer our meeting attendees shuttle service. The sales staff at the first location took care of everything, and transferred our block of rooms to the Broadway proprerty. I can't thank them enough for this service! Based on my experience here, I would return to this hotel, or try any of the other Silver Cloud properties.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MauiGirl604
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice experience! The hotel was in a convenient area of the city, with two hospitals and a university close by. Restaurants were within close proximity. The room was comfortable and kept clean. The staff were very nice, helpful, and friendly. We felt welcomed and efforts were made to make our stay comfortable. The underground garage worked well for parking, though there was a charge for parking. We would most likely consider this hotel again when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morevacslesswork
Reviews.Content: We received this hotel through a Hotwire booking, and didn't know what to expect as we normally stay in the downtown core area. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff were welcoming and friendly and check in and througout our stay. The free shuttle was great, especially for transportation to and from Safeco Field for Mariners games. We didn't bother using the shuttle for transportation downtown as it's only a 15 minute walk to/from the core district and the hills are really quite minimal. Another great feature of this hotel is a fridge in the room and the fact that a grocery store is only a block away so you can have some fresh fruit (or other snacks) in your room. We used the in-house restaurant for one dinner meal and agreed that it was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and the free shuttle only makes things even better”
Reviews.Author: roberts1892
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as Seattle was the middle stop on a 3 centre US self organised trip. About a mile from the waterfront and uphill but the half hourly free shuttle from 7am to 10.30 pm to four of the main tourist sites makes the location no issue. Large, immaculately clean, spacious rooms and each floor has a (free to use) large washer with separate drier which enabled us to do our laundry quickly and easily. If you are on a road trip this is a real boon, trust me! Staff were all really helpful and for the beer lovers amongst us Jimmy's the bar on site has a good beer selection and a great value happy hour. When we next visit Seattle (and we will) this will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice functional hotel. Nothing too fancy. Good place to stay if you're visiting the medical centers”
Reviews.Author: Grisle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, prior to taking the Amtrak Cascades from Seattle to Vancouver. The hotel is nice and clean. It is very functional, and the staff is efficient and friendly. Location was good for us, as we visited some family living nearby. It's a popular hotel for people visiting the medical facilities located nearby. Although it is a bit out of the way from downtown, the shuttle service was prompt and accomodating. We booked this hotel through Hotwire. Got a good price. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi04NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and were delighted to be upgraded at no cost to a suite. The suite was generously sized and appointed. We chose the property based on previous positive experience with Silver Cloud and were not disappointed. The only criticism is that Wi-fi was a little slow. The adjoining Jimmy's restaurant was excellent - great cocktails and top quality meals.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a wonderful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Linda G
Reviews.Content: For the second time, we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. (We stayed for several nights 3 years ago.) Once again, our room was lovely -- large, clean, nicely furnished, with comfortable beds. The free shuttle service was fast and reliable, both for being taken downtown AND for being picked up again! The hotel desk staff were uniformly helpful and friendly. We did not try the restaurant attached to the hotel on this visit; instead we had fun choosing a restaurant from numerous good options within a 10-minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise stop over”
Reviews.Author: Cdn-uxbridge
Reviews.Content: Hotel beautiful...Hotwire hotel. A bit far from Pier 91 but with hotwire you never know where you are staying until you've paid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Modern Hotel in Capitol Hill neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: alliesana
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very modern and clean rooms. Only two disappointments: 1. We booked through Hotwire, who includes this hotel in their "Downtown - Pike's Place" area. This definition is misleading, as this hotel is in Capitol Hill, a solid half hour walk from Pike's Place. There's a reason the Silver Cloud offers a shuttle to downtown...because this hotel is NOT downtown! This is a Hotwire zoning issue; the Silver Cloud Hotel is very nice. We enjoyed exploring the Capitol Hill neighborhood, as it has lots of great restaurants and bars. Try Poppy on Broadway for a memorable dinner, and head 1.5 blocks up Madison to Cafe Arosa for the best mocha and snack waffle around. 2. The tea bags in the room are Lipton. From an establishment this nice and modern, I would expect a more premium brand, say Numi, Mighty Leaf or even Tazo. Seattle is a coffee-fueled town, but some of us visitors are tea-drinkers, and Lipton doesn't cut it. Would absolutely stay here again, and props to Lena at the front desk for being so friendly and accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Can't wait to have a girl's weekend away there!”
Reviews.Author: Barb1058
Reviews.Content: Nice BIG room, spotlessly clean, comfy beds, SUPERB staff-so helpful and go out of their way to please you. The refrigerator in our room wasn't working (we realized this after putting milk in it overnight); after calling someone was there to fix it w/in 15 minutes AND they gave us free milk the rest of our stay so we wouldn't have to replace ours. It's a 15 minute easy walk to downtown from up on Capitol Hill although they do have a free shuttle that leaves every 30 minutes to 4 drop offs (and on game days to a stop just 2 blocks from the stadiums); pick-ups from downtown just require a phone call and they'll be there w/in 15 minutes-such a nice handy extra. But walk it if you can-it's beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable. would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is not in the tourist area of downtown. I question why this location would be included, but technically it is downtown. My initial reaction from getting this property on Priceline was disappointment, however that changed once we arrived. The hotel is less than 10 years old and is in excellent condition. The lobby is very comfortable with friendly staff and complimentary coffee/tea station. This in one of the only hotels (per bellmen) that still operates a complimentary shuttle van service. This is a must in my opinion to attract guests to this hotel. The van runs on the half hour for a short ride to several locations, including Safeco on game days. You call the hotel when ready for a pick-up. There is a parking garage for $16 per day, a bargain compared to other cities. There is a bus that goes by the hotel, but I did not use it. I did walk to Westlake Center which took about 20 minutes, downhill there, uphill back. The restaurant at the hotel, Jimmy's was surprisingly good. It is overpriced, as hotel restaurants tend to be, but quality was good and they had happy hour for discount drinks and appetizers. They also have room service. For off property food, there is an International House of Pancakes behind the hotel, and a McDonalds a couple blocks away, as well as a couple other breakfast/lunch places a few blocks away. there was a list in the hotel directory in the room. The bed was very comfortable with a fairly large room with mini-fride and microwave. Large screen flat panel TV in room. The bathroom was decent size with hot water and nice shower. The tub did drain slowly. Security enabled elevators need room key to access guest floors. I do not know about safety of neighborhood, but it did not seem so bad. there are two hospitals within a couple blocks and there were some homelss people panhandling in the city. but this was not an issue near the hotel that I encountered. They were the most polite panhandelers I have encoutered, with a thank-you when declining to give money. The city is clean with fresh air. The public transit is free in the downtown district. I checked out the light link for one stop downtown. nice clean stations. Van shuttle to Safeco, Pike Place Market, Westlake Center (shopping and transit), and Pioneer Square make this property a value compared to the hyatt/crown plaza type room rates. The only downside is that you do not walk right out to attractions. I would definitley stay at the Silver Cloud again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations by miles - clean, modern, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dciesq
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here with my spouse and 6 year old daughter. I tend to veer towards the national chains when I don't personally know the hotel or have a friend's recommendation, but in this case we were attending a conference for which this was the official hotel. From the moment we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was attractive and immaculately clean. In fact, the whole hotel was extremely clean, and everything was modern and in perfect repair. The room was a nice, upscale but standard accommodation, except for the microwave, fridge (no minibar, which was good w a 6 yr old) and wetbar. Also, I loved that we could get a king sized bed and there was a twin pull out couch for the kid. The pool and spa area was wonderful, the pool is big enough to play in with the kid. The workout facilities are small but well maintained and equipped. I only have three complaints/negatives: 1) even though we were on the fifth floor, we could hear traffic noise despite the double-glazed windows; 2) while the room was in great shape and very clean, housekeeping was a little inconsistent (e.g. we left a note asking for extra towels, but fewer left than we started with); 3) opening hours of the pool and fitness center are incorrect in the guest booklet in the room (which led to some disappointment when we missed the pool window by minutes our first day). Overall, a great hotel and I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous stay...”
Reviews.Author: RoniKris
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud had everything you might have wished for in a hotel. Lovely room, refrigerator, laundry on every floor, pool as well as an extremely helpful staff.. Although on the outer edge of downtown, there is a shuttle that can drop you off and pick you up at key locations. On most mornings I did the 15-20 minute walk down the hill to Pikes Market. The hotel is also walking distance to Elliot Bay Books (just off Broadway) and Molly Moon's Ice Cream. I would not think of staying at anyplace else next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_CanadaRick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with the family and friends. We took advantage of the free shuttle that the hotel offers to the downtown area. Parking however at the hotel is a bit pricey at $16 per day and room rates were $169 and up (just my opinion). Jimmy's on Broadway inside the hotel is worth trying if you don't feel like heading into town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 907tripper
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Swedish Medical; shuttle seervice is great to oher parts of city as well. Nice food service; room service food was still hot, which was appreciated. Would recommend to even my pickiest friends!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Seattle University”
Reviews.Author: Joebuyer
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for parents of Seattle University students. Literally across the street. Room was clean, but a little small (we had odd shaped room next to elevator). Highly recommend the on site restaurant (Nicks???). Breakfast was great and I had wish I had known about the great beer selection on tap. It's a little pricey for a Silver Cloud, but better rates than most places in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Hotel-Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here and have only one problem. (which I'll get to a bit later) Staff was excellent and lobby/rooms were well maintained. There is a free shuttle that will drop you off at downtown points of interest like Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square and Westlake center near the mall and light rail. Now my one issue is not with he hotel but with priceline. I bid on 3.5* downtown near Pikes Place and was surprised to receive this hotel which is not in downtown. It is in a neighborhood on the outskirts of downtown called "Capitol Hill" a nearly 20 min walk just to get to the center of downtown. I feel this is misleading and priceline needs to define this zone separately. As for the immediate neighborhood it's in a "gay friendly" neighborhood similar to "the village" in NYC, except a bit quieter/low-key if that's your scene. Also near is a hospital and University. That said, the free shuttle to downtown was extremely helpful. Because of this and the absolutely pleasant stay I had, I actually wouldn't mind returning to this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Will make it our Seattle go-to hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jennidwit
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet for a getaway. Not the best location to explore after hours, but perfect for our needs of spending the day downtown and sleep. Liked the security of the required room key for the elevators. Also grabbed a bite to eat at the hotel restaurant, Jimmy's. Good food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “a great mid price hotel”
Reviews.Author: london_traveller062
Reviews.Content: I'm an english, 40-something professional guy who travels a reasonable amount for work and for pleasure. Stayed here with a friend for 7 or so nights over a 2 week period in June / July 2011. We both REALLY enjoyed our stay here. The Silver Cloud broadway is a great mid-price hotel. Things we liked about it : - the rooms are quiet and large, v comfortable with good beds, bathrooms, flat screen and free wifi - really excellent service. The staff here - particularly front-of-house - were consistently v helpful in answering all our questions on seattle stuff from restaurants, making calls overseas, even where would be the best place from which to view the 4th July fireworks - location. it is one of the few ( only ? ) hotel in the fun and diverse capitol hill area. most other hotels are in the busy downtown area which is more full-on urban. - the frequent shuttle to downtown was great and saves a lot of money on cabs - no laundry service but high quality washer and driers on each floor made laundry v easy if needed A couple of small quibbles : - the hotel restaurant Jimmy's was a little bit soul-less and quiet. we only had breakfast there so maybe dinner would be busier. The service was sometimes a bit slow - add a ' clean me now' tag to the doors so rooms can be cleaned promptly. rooms were sometimes cleaned a bit late in the day - maybe add an ipod dock in each room ? Overall : a really excellent mid-priced hotel that punches above its weight

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path...but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: statue1
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice Hotel, that compares favorably to the Seattle Kimpton properties, it's away from the tourist attractions but they have a very good Hotel shuttle. The Hotel is first class, and has well appointed rooms and a very good resturant and bar. The location was a new area of Seattle for me. The Capitol Hill neighborhood is a great walking area with dozens of interesting resturants, bars and shops. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Joonthego
Reviews.Content: As with the Silver Cloud at Stadium the customer service/front counter staff are professional and helpful. The rooms are clean, roomy, have a kitchenette and a nice TV. As we were going to the Seattle Mariner's game we found this a little out of the way and in a neighbourhood full of different sorts of folks (some good some bad I guess you could say). The Hotel has a shuttle to take you places so that is helpful. The biggest pro for me was the parking is inexpensive enough and as we were attending a ball game and would be returning AFTER check out the hotel was more than happy to allow us to leave our vehicle in their parking garage at no extra charge. BONUS points for that. The cons: out of the way for what we wanted and the neighbourhood didn't seem all that upscale (but was not run down).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TJP66
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here while stopping in Seattle. Check in was quick and friendly. The room is clean and modern. The restaurant downstairs is Jimmy's and I highly recommend it. It would be a good stand alone restaurant so for a hotel one it is 5* The hotel isn't walking distance to Pike Place or shopping but they offer a free shuttle. Good idea as parking is scarce and expensive around Pike Pl. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: karench14
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Silver Cloud on Broadway after using HotWire and entering Downtown Seattle as the parameter. When we found out where this hotel was, we were disappointed because it is not in the middle of everything (it is on the other side of the main highway so to me that isn't the Downtown) and my husband had a conference to go to in the Downtown area. The shuttle was helpful in getting him where he needed to be, though. I have to say that once we were there and I got my bearings, it worked out better than I would have thought! The lobby is lovely and the rooms are spacious enough. The bathroom isn't special but it is definitely sufficient...except for the hair dryer. Unless I completely missed something, this could be the most annoying dryer I have ever encountered - you have to hold the button in the ENTIRE time you are drying your hair. Forget it if you want to use the cool shot button - it was like acrobatics. Ladies you know what I am talking about. For a nice hotel, they need different dryers! There was a sink, fridge and microwave in the room which is a total plus! I could actually take leftovers!! We didn't get a chance to eat at Jimmy's and I see another reviewer wrote they had a free breakfast. If that is true we completely missed that memo. In fact room service was quite pricey but that is not unexpected. The shuttle is great. It runs on the half hour from the hotel and picks up from the 4 locations (Pike Place, i.e.) on the quarter hour. You just call the hotel and they let the driver know where you are. I went running one morning along the water and was dropped off and picked up promptly. Now if I had done my research ahead of time, I would have just run back to the hotel! I learned after some exploring that the hotel is a 15-20 minute brisk walk to the downtown. I took Pine St. straight down to the water and it was so simple. So you have options. I also walked around the area surrouding the hotel. There are a few restaurants (chains - Subway and Panera, and non-chains), coffee shops (Starbucks and otherwise), a college, a hospital and boutiques. I stayed on Broadway and just walked up and down, stopped in the food store for lunch, and got a pedicure. There isn't a ton to do in the immediate vicinity but I love wandering so it worked for me for an hour or 2. There is an Urban Outfitters but it is the only mainstream store I saw. I used the fitness center and it was small but fine. I believe there were 3 treadmills, 1 elliptical and a nautilus type weight machine. I may have missed something...maybe there was a bike too but I don't remember. I used the treadmill and it was good. The pool and hot tub looked nice and I wish I had more time to try them out. I would recommend this hotel if you are okay with not being in the center of everything by the water. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: khgee
Reviews.Content: I was warmly greeted every time I passed the front desk. Sheets clean, room clean, a very cozy property. The onsite restaurant, Jimmys on Broadway, exceeded my expectations. The portions were surprisingly large, can be a bit pricey as expected from hotel restaurants. The price of the room was slightly below the average median which made for a great value. Wasn't very knowledgable about my surroundings so I don't know how to fairly rate the hotels location. Overall a great property, I will be returning. PS- Kudos for the hotel-SEA shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing hideaway in the middle of an energy filled city.”
Reviews.Author: sebastian97
Reviews.Content: We visit Seattle often, visiting family and old friends. We enjoy taking part of the hustle-bustle on Broadway and downtown that we left several years ago. The Broadway Silvercloud has become our home away from home. On almost every trip we use the excellent shuttle service to and from various locations both during the day and at night. Our rooms have always been very clean, well appointed, comfortable and quiet. I feel very secure leaving my car in the easily accessable parking garage. 'Jimmies On Broadway' their new in house restaurant has a good menu that is resonably priced and has been a life saver on those stay-in nights and those late morning get-ups.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilyWilson3333
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed overnight at the Broadway Silver Cloud for our anniversary. It was a beautiful hotel with great service. We'll stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle location, modern hotel, and the staff were very friendly and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: KateMenz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Silver Cloud in Mukilteo and thought we would take the kids for an overnight in downtown Seattle. This hotel was immaculate and the furnishings were so modern and up to date. The restaurant, Jimmy's, was excellent! The shuttle service was really convenient. We were impressed and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: lexietom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible! Dont ever go there! I had sent them a credit card authorization for our corporate card for my room and meals & tax the day before my stay. I get there and they need a credit card for incidentals. I asked how much, they say $50. So since I didnt bring the corporate card with me I give them my credit card. I stay and check out the next morning. I checked my bank account and they took out a $50 charge, a $150 charge and $75 charge!!! I did not use anything in that room. I checked in late that night slept and checked out first thing in the morning. TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Mutt99
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire, as I usually do, and the Silver Cloud on Broadway came up as the selection. Got a great rate. OK, it's not located right downtown but a 10-20 minute walk (downhill) will get to Pioneer Square or Pike Market. The walk back uphill is more of a challenge but a great workout after chowing down on all of Seattle's great food. My room was spotless, large and had modern amenities. The windows open! This is a very significant bonus feature for me because I really don't like the typical hermetically sealed hotel room. The staff that I encountered were friendly and helpful. I had breakfast at Jimmy's a couple of mornings and the server did not hesitate to fulfill my self admittedly special requests. At night the bar is a nice refuge with an excellent Scotch and craft beer selection. All in all, I enjoyed myself and would stay there again. My only complaint was the $20/night parking charge that seems a bit excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, NOT a downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: KeriW
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself as a downtown hotel, however if you are expecting to walk to downtown attrations such as Pike Place Market do not book here. It is over a mile to downtown, and the walk back is VERY uphill. The location however is great if you aren't looking to walk to downtown attractions. It is in a very cool, trendy area with bars and restaurants close by. The Garage next door to the hotel is a fun place with a pool hall, bowling lanes, and a bar. The area is pretty loud, there is a lot of foot traffic, especailly after the bars close. This is the first time we've stayed in a Silver Cloud so don't know the caliber that they usually provide. This Silver Cloud says it is 3 1/2 stars, that might be a little high but a three for sure. The rooms are good sized with small fridge's and microwaves with a small wet bar type area. Counter tops are granite, the rooms were very clean, they all have doors that open to let the fresh air in, but no screens on them, which was a little weird. The beds were comfortable but nothing spectacular, the sheets are too small like most hotel sheets seem to be. The spout on the tub was loose and we had to tighten it and also the iron in our room didn't work (we were provided with another one promptly that did work). The front desk staff upon check in in the evening was very very nice and helpful, the woman upon checkout in the morning however was NOT, she was rude and short with me when explaining some unexpected charges on our room. We called down to the front desk to extra towels at 9:30 am and they were never delivered, so we had to reuse which was annoying to say the least. Our extra towels did finally show up when our room was cleaned, however our room wasnt cleaned until after 4:00 pm even though housekeeping was working down the hall when we left the hotel at 10:30 am. Upon checkin they give you a card for a free appitizer at the hotel restaurant/bar with a $15 purchase. We didn't get a chance to use it as the place closes at 11:00 pm and we got back too late. As stated in other reviews, the pool and spa are only accessible through the parking garage, however this wasn't an inconvenience at all as you don't have to walk through a lobby or anything to get to it so it isn't bad. The pool is nice and clean, the spa was as well but not very warm. The workout room is nicely equipped with new machines and a TV. Overall the hotel is average. We booked on Priceline so we were able to get a much better deal than what is offered on the hotel website. The room wouldn't have been worth the full price, but was definitly worth the Priceline price. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not much to set it apart”
Reviews.Author: JennyRCoconut
Reviews.Content: After reading all the glowing reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor and on other sites I was really looking forward an extended stay there for business near the end of January 2011. It is a very nice hotel, and quite clean, and the room was nice sized with a very small refrigerator, bar sink and microwave. The front desk staff was not overly friendly: I stayed there for almost two weeks, and so saw most of the same people every day, and rarely even got a smile or "Hi". They were not very communicative at check in about how much parking would be, I had no idea until I saw the charges show up on my card about a week into my stay. Every three days or so, my room key would cease to work, so I'd have to have it rescanned. The beds were very uncomfortable. The queen mattresses were lumpy, and seemed like they were just slightly larger than the box springs, so that if you didn't lie directly in the center of the bed, it would shift to one side or the other. That, coupled with the fact that the sheets were too small for the mattress so were constantly coming off anytime you moved, made for an uncomfortable night's sleep. The business center left a lot to be desired, as the fax machine wouldn't work the one time I needed it, and one of the two computers that were available for public internet access seemed to constantly be flashing virus warnings. I also didn't like the fact that they don't offer anything for breakfast except for Jimmy's (the restaurant on premises), since I ate there one morning and was not impressed. About the only thing I can say truly impressed me about this hotel was the shuttle drivers. They were very knowledgeable about the city and made the rides fun. As I said in the title, its a nice hotel, and might work for a few nights, but if you're planning an extended stay I'd recommend Homewood Suites. I've stayed there in other cities, and will recommend them to my company for future visits. Their prices are similar, but they have bigger rooms with full kitchens and free hot breakfasts, in addition to the other amenities that this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- Service is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ARavanilaw
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Silver Cloud Hotel on First Hill for business on a regular basis. I started staying with the Silver Cloud in 2008. I have had nothing but exemplarily service from this hotel. The desk employees are courteous and professional. I travel nine weeks out of the year for business, and this will be my first hotel review that I have ever participated in. I have always felt that hotels being in the service industry, that it was their job to provide customer service. I am writing this review because out of all the hotels I stay in, the service at the Silver Cloud Hotel on First Hill is a couple notches above the competition. Since 2008, I have seen a slew of desk employees come and go, but all of them treat me the same when I check-in, with a warm smile and friendly hello. Great Job Silver Cloud Inn!

Reviews.Title: “clean very helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel060
Reviews.Content: outstanding shuttle to 4 places downtown; very helpful drivers; night staff took their time with us when checking in late; very accomodating

Reviews.Title: “Great home base to explore Seattle”
Reviews.Author: babycobalt
Reviews.Content: Having come here directly from a surprisingly unpleasant experience in Salt Lake CIty, I was very nervous to stay at another local hotel chain with which I was unfamiliar. Well Silver Cloud was a BIG sigh of relief. Easily reached from the airport without a car (take the light rail to the last stop--5th and pine/Westlake Center Mall, which felt safe to wait even at 10 pm--and call the hotel for shuttle pickup from there). The rooms are up-to-date, clean, spacious, and comfortable with wifi, a minifridge and coffeemaker with Tully's coffee (as well as brewed coffee and a selection of teas in the lobby), business center with printer in the lobby. The fitness center and pool aren't glamorous--you have to go through the parking garage to get there--but are clean and well-maintained. Is it downtown? Definitely not. I would argue it's in kind of a convenient spot, though. Next to Swedish and Virginia Mason and easily walkable to Harborview (maybe too far to walk if you're there as a patient, though), next to Seattle U, QFC supermarket 1 block away, Capitol Hill restaurants are a healthy but pleasant hike (work off all that delicious food!), and, if you have comfy walking shoes downtown is easily reached on foot--and the shuttle will bring you back when you wear out those walking feet! The staff were helpful and the shuttle driver unfailingly friendly and helpful in pointing out places of interest on the route.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right near Seattle U”
Reviews.Author: DebYlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with my daughter while touring Seattle U. Room was nice and comfortable, two queen beds, nice desk and comfortable sitting chair and ottoman. Nice flat screen TV, bar area and decent bathroom. Free wi-fi is always a plus. We ate one dinner and breakfast at the restaurant, it was good. Used the free shuttle to downtown, was convenient and never had to wait long for a return trip. Only complaint was the directions I was given to a nearby restaurant were wrong. I didn't think they sounded right so I used the GPS on my phone, good thing or we would have been going in the wrong direction in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but hotel staff leaves a lot to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: Sae_adub
Reviews.Content: Like many on here I decided to stay here because priceline put me up at this hotel. It was far from downtown, but the shuttle service was nice to drop you off. The pick up was not as convienAnt. They would only meet you at 4 different areas throughout the city and I had to call severAl times to get a hold of someone. This leads to another complaint. They should not be able to put that they have a concierge on their webpage when there is no concierge available. What they have is a front desk, and that is all. Several times I tried speaking to the front desk and they always tried to rush me off the phone. Terrible customer service and here is he kicker: My girlfriend and I showed up at midnight to the hotel and asked about getting something to drink. All we wanted was water. They front desk told us that they would give us two bottles that were warm. We were appreciative until we saw the hotel bill. Six dollars for two small bottles of water that were warm and given to us as if they were complimentary. Terrible staff, terrible customer service , and the restaurant was not great. Had the chicken wings at the bar and they tasted as if the oil they had used to cook them was 5 years-old. Skip this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, clean hotel - it was a pleasure to stay at the Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: Marklaw
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud is a rather nice hotel with clean, quiet rooms and a very pleasant staff. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds which were very comfortable and provided a good night's sleep. The room was quiet and fairly spacious. There is fast, free WIFI and a nice flat panel TV. It's a non-smoking hotel and when our hallway filled up with the odor of cig smoke the hotel sent an engineer up to find the source and put an end to it. There is coffee available in the lobby all day and also a basket of apples. I didn't use the fitness center but a friend did and he rated it a B-. I wasn't too enamored to pay $16 per night for parking but, given the area, it's not an unreasonable charge or rate. The hotel is right across from Seattle University and Swedish Hospital as well as right in the middle of a very hipster area with lots of places to eat. I didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant so cannot comment on that. There is an IHOP right next door and had two decent breakfasts there. The hotel has a free shuttle that will take you to several locations. The driver was friendly and knows the area so you can ask him for suggestions of things to do, places to eat, etc. Remember to tip him! A friend and his family took the light rail in from the airport and was picked up by the hotel shuttle. They called the hotel from the train and the shuttle arrived at the pickup point in a timely manner. This is a nice hotel and the room rates are reasonable. It's a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Closest hotel to Swedish Hospital and Seattle University”
Reviews.Author: travelbanana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a doctor's appointment next to Swedish. It wasn't bad, price didn't seem too bad but I felt amenities were lacking. If not going to Swedish or SU I wouldn't stay here. I walked to QFC as I arrived late due to weather. Front desk person was unfriendly. Rooms were small but space was well used. Comfy bed and nice 42' flat screen TV. Morning staff was much friendlier and efficient than their evening counterpart. If you get there early enough quite a few little restaurants, cafes, and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: SullyB5
Reviews.Content: I took my grandson to Seattle for his 8th birthday present. We were both very pleased with the hotel, its wonderful restaurant, and convenient shuttle service to downtown sites. The staff was professional, friendly, and helpful at every turn. Room clean and comfortable. Walking distance to great grocery store and several restaurants. I would stay here again with absolutely no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “2 Night Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsVan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Friday and Saturday night in November Nice little hotel - Stayed in a King Bed room 648 - Corner suite Very clean and quiet - Parking $16 per night Shuttle service is great and easy to use Lots of bars and restuarants in area Walked down Boradway to El Mestizo Mexcian restaurant - loved the food Staff very polite and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1st Hill destination”
Reviews.Author: Semibum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Broadway Silver Cloud the night before surgery at Harborview Medical Center. The location is ideal if you have to be at HMC or Swedish, a little less so relative to downtown. There is a free shuttle to the main downtown attractions. The hotel is very nice, lobby-to-rooms. The front desk personnel was pleasant and personable and the rooms are generous and well appointed. Room service was speedy and the food was well prepared albeit unremarkable. Parking – for a nightly fee - is in an underground garage. Overall, an excellent choice if you need to be on or around first hill.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Downtown but Charming Shuttle Ride & Elliott Bay Books Close”
Reviews.Author: KnitterwithSuitcase
Reviews.Content: Slight tussle with Priceline over their assertion that this Silver Cloud is downtown, it's NOT. However, having gotten there (it's on Capitol Hill), great ambiance, quiet, very clean, roomy, welcoming, and one of the friendliest and most charming shuttle drivers ever. Extra bonus, Elliott Bay Books and their nice cafe are a few blocks away -- I wouldn't have come close if I'd stayed downtown. This Silver Cloud has a silver lining.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful and courteous staff, convenient to area hospitals.”
Reviews.Author: cherylm1955
Reviews.Content: I came to Seattle with my Dad for surgery at Harborview. The hotel staff was very helpful, the shuttle takes you right to where you need to go(hospital) and picks you up when ever you are ready to leave, saves on not so convenient and expensive parking at hospital. The room was very clean and comfortable. The food and service at Jimmy's was excellent also. Parking fees, for Seattle, really not so bad. I would certainly recommend the Silver Cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place although not exactly downtown”
Reviews.Author: GH_RTW
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Priceline where it was advertised as "downtown". Well it's a little outside the downtown area on the other side of the highway. At first I was not really happy with the location. But after staying there I can say that walking from the hotel to downtown locations such as Pike's Place isn't too bad. And if you don't want to walk they have a shuttle (although I didn't use it). Rooms are comfy and a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DaleRobyn
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through PriceLIne. We travel to Seattle frequently and usually stay downtown at one of two favourite hotels but with Priceline we thought we'd try somewhere else for this 4 day trip. The hotel was excellent. The people at the front desk were efficient and very friendly. As it was our anniversary, they kindly upgraded us to a larger room on the top floor. The room was perfect and very clean. Jimmy's, the hotel's restaurant, was excellent. We were very pleased with everything we ordered. The hotel is situated in Capitol Hill. On our first day there we took the time to walk around the neighborhood. It is very funky, filled with coffee shops, clubs, and interesting stores. As well, there are several major hospital and two colleges within blocks. The swimming pool is excellent. It's hidden away in the parking garage - a somewhat unusual location - but easy to get to. The hotel offers free shuttle service to and from downtown shopping, Pike Place Market, and Pioneer Square. We used this service frequently and were very happy with it! All in all - its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with everything!”
Reviews.Author: kellieab67
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel after I was released from the hospital after having c-spine surgery and was wearing a c-spine collar. The assistant manager checking us in was extremely gracious, and immediately upgraded us to a jaccuzi suite with fireplace after taking one look at me. The staff was very warm and professional; our room was absolutely exceptional; the jaccuzi tub and fireplace amazing! The room service from the new restaurant, Jimmy's was also great. They had cooked something incorrectly to my friends meal, and upon calling them, they quickly brought up the right meal and gave us a discount. We would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Price, and Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Ratzilla
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel with tons of different ethnic eateries within blocks. Staff and servers at the hotel restaurant "Jimmy's" very friendly and accommodating. Hotel is about 1 mile from Pike Place Market however hotel offers a shuttle to 5 different stops around the Seattle downtown area. If you don’t want to hoof it, take the shuttle. Driver Neil gave us the history of the city and neighborhoods has he drove us to the Pike Place shuttle drop off point. Bartender Brenda at Jimmy’s offered tastings of local beers that we weren’t familiar with. She was great!! Our room had a Refrig. and microwave. 1 block away was a 24hr grocery store. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay - in the middle of the action...”
Reviews.Author: mckinley88
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were to be in seattle for the weekend. we had previously booked another room at a different hotel, but when we were unable to check in a day earlier then we had planned (extra vacay day - bonus!!!), we were able to sneak a night in at the silver cloud. quite a nice hotel with friendly staff and situated right next to all of the action happening in the capitol hill and pike/pine neighborhoods. we enjoyed a clean and quiet room with a nice step out to a shared courtyard. surprisingly quiet for it's location on such a busy street in a bustling commercial area. a nice, quick walk to tons of restaurants and shops, and the salted caramel ice cream just up and around the corner at molly moo... (incredible!!) a bit steep for parking ($16), but nice and secure. i guess i'm just spoiled never having to pay when i'm around home... altogether, quite a pleasant and enjoyable stay - even if only for one night. we wish we could have stayed a bit longer. for security conscious travellers - this hotel is outstanding. access to guest floors is by key card only. we always feel very safe and comfortable at any of the silver cloud locations where we've stayed... one minor ding - there was a bit of peeling paint on the bathroom ceiling and dingy sealant on the bathtub. not bad at all, but totally unexpected given the general condition of the property and the somewhat upscale presentation elsewhere. otherwise room was spotless and very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: KianiJ
Reviews.Content: Loved hotel location and everything about it! Secured gated parking garage large enough to fit our 4 door Dodge was an added bonus. Everything about this hotel was superb except for the no cable thing, that made it really boring when you were in between places. But other than that I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: yiching
Reviews.Content: Went for a three day road trip to Seattle with another family with young kids. After searching on travelocity and other websites for two weeks and finding nothing in the city for a reasonable price, decided to priceline it. Got the Silver Cloud for literally half price. The hotel met and exceeded our expectations in spades. First off, although it's rated at three stars, the hotel is really more like three and a half in our opinion. The rooms are very nice, even a little luxurious. Combined with the great indoor pool, the free breakfast buffet, and the shuttle, we all had a great experience. Yes, the parking costs $16 a night, but how many city hotels don't charge for parking? We took the shuttle every day, sometimes two or three times a day. I just kept thinking how much hassle and money the shuttle saved us. Highly recommended, especially for half price!

Reviews.Title: “A super place to stay in Seattle!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zeeber
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until the day we left, we were treated like VIP's! Although we had hoped to have our room upgrade because of a special anniversary, this was not possible in the end. However, the check-in clerk tried her best as did the Front Manager and we were treated to chocolates, free appetizers and very good service. Our room was large enough and the free internet was reliable and fast (a really BIG bonus for us!). WE also were pleasantly surprised to have a little kitchenette complete with sink, microwave and fridge. We loved the free shuttle and the drivers were just great! One in particular was so knowledgeable about Seattle and he gave us a colourful history as we drove into the downtown area -- please keep this service! It is a reason we would go back. We were disappointed in the pool and spa area as these were in the parking garage and quite dark and unfriendly. It seems as though these were an afterthought in terms of the design. The breakfasts in the newly renovated Jimmy's were very very good and the staff here was friendly and bright. We loved the area near Seattle University and the price point of the hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service issues.”
Reviews.Author: Storrs
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms with priceline at very short notice and I don’t think we would have stayed at this location if we wished to visit downtown Seattle. There is, however, a free shuttle bus that stops at all the major downtown sights and the drivers are very friendly and knowledgeable which makes up for the location. We had some trouble while at the hotel; we were refused two rooms together at check-in. We took one room and then came back and spoke to another member of staff who booked us to the room next door without a problem. However, when we returned to the hotel that evening one of our rooms had been let to somebody else. We walked into a room with other guest’s personal effects all over the place. The duty manager clearly had no idea what had gone wrong but found us another room. The following day the reception desk sent the shuttle bus to the wrong place to pick us up downtown, leaving us stood around for 40 minutes. In conclusion, an OK hotel in not a great location and with some customer service issues.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a hotel we never would...”
Reviews.Author: mafootje
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a hotel we never would have booked ourselves. We used priceline and they made the choose for us. The hotel location wasn't optimal for visiting the city center. But they offered a free shuttle that runs every half hour to different city center locations. Parking is available under the hotel at a rate of $16 a night. Rooms are great could be a bit larger. The room has a microwave, small fridge and large flatscreen tv. No HD channels are offered. The rest is just great, excellent bed low outside noise. Great up to date room.

Reviews.Title: “Met but did not exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: sarahalta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well kept and clean. It was chosen for me through Priceline. The reception I received when I arrived at the hotel was fine. Nothing out of the ordinary but it was the end of the shift so I am sure the woman was ready to be done. On the other hand, the reception when I checked out was fantastic. I think there was free wi-fi but I did not bring my computer. I used their business center. If you are techie I would bring your own computer because theirs are pretty old. The lobby was nice. They have nice beauty care products in the room (Aveda). It was a bit far from the train station but I am so glad I stayed there (and then moved downtown to another hotel) because it was a beautiful walk down Pike Street. I got a great deal on Priceline and it met but did not exceed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, slightly pricey”
Reviews.Author: bklyngalinla
Reviews.Content: Hotel was one of two selected by wedding party for guests. Block rate was not much of a discount. Hotel staff is lovely and helpful. King room was good sized and comfortable. I was in handicapped room. No fancy amenities except bar sink plus personal sink. It's great to have microwave and tiny fridge - which didn't make any noise but which was not very cold inside. Soft drinks and ice maker on the floor, as well as one-machine laundry facility (washing is free, detergent sold in gift shop.) Bed was uncomfortably hard and slanted and room carpet was filthy but everything else appeared clean. Restaurant under construction. I never woke up early enough for complimentary continental breakfast but there's coffee and apples in the lobby all the time. Ihop located right around back. Location seems to be in questionable area but is actually right at the end of Capitol Hill, near major highways. Parking is $16/night. My key didn't work in garage entrance so I came in the front driveway which is easy to miss the first time. No bell service at all, transport your own luggage. Hotel provides shuttle service downtown and Pike St. I heard them offer someone taxi reimbursement when shuttle got delayed. Free pc use, but computers are pretty sluggish.

Reviews.Title: “First rate at First Hill”
Reviews.Author: traveleradlib
Reviews.Content: Took Light rail from airport to Westlake Center, called hotel--shuttle within 10 min. Also picks up at Pioneer Square and Sport Arena area Rooms were great : refrig., coffee pot with "Tullys" coffee PLUS microwave. Large floor to ceiling window with railing: "door' designed to open limited amount..,adequate for fresh air but very safe.( Could be opened farther if desired) Desk with free internet-also Business area in lobby with use of computers and printer. New restaurant under remodel and will have breakfast "free" for guests.Great exercise room and beautiful pool (inside) Front desk people very helpful with directions and will print out maps to get to requested places. MY BIGGEST find --Elliott Bay Bookstore (formerly in Pioneer Square area) about 4-5 block away. Great bookstore,coffee shop and very helpful and friendly people.. 2 blocks to supermarket (QFC) with good Deli and Starbucks. Cute bar and poolhall nextdoor,originally a garage. Several buses stop out front that goes up and down Broadway P.S. I noted the shuttle would drop guests off at "other" places, i.e Convention Centers, medical buildings, Pikes Market,Cruise ship terminal. Booked thru Orbitz at $115, my brother thru Priceline for $90 We will definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, but pricey parking.”
Reviews.Author: robbertbobbert
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. It's in a great location, right on Broadway and Madison. I was there for my sister's graduation from Seattle University and this hotel is directly across the street from their campus. The beds were very comfortable and everything looked new. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast had a good variety and was open for a good amount of time each morning. The only negative was that you had to pay for parking ($19 per car per night!) and they did not inform my mother of this when she made our reservations. Between myself, my parents and two of my friends we had five cars, so that was almost $200 for parking for just a weekend. The parking lot is also small but we were always able to find spots. It seems very secure which is reassuring in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “No bell captain, no bell hop, handle your own luggage, out-of-the way location!”
Reviews.Author: hmstins
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but I was traveling with my 91-year old mother prior to boarding an Alaska cruise. We pulled up in a Towncar svc vehicle and our driver unloaded our luggage and left. No one came out, no one offered to help with our luggage, and when it was time to go to our room they told me I could use one of their luggage carts! I was flabbergasted that no bell service was available. I tip nicely when I travel and I expect a normal level of service. This was unacceptable. When we left to go to the cruise ship, there was no one to help us with the luggage again. I went downstairs, was given a luggage cart, and had to hustle all our luggage myself! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “The walls aren't thick enough.”
Reviews.Author: ruthfacebk
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Silver Cloud Broadway. The people to my east are arguing with their toddlers, the couple to my west just used the bathroom. Last night after a major room change that took an hour and involved screaming children running down the hall the couple to my east decided blocking the stairwell door open and yelling in that echo chamber was a good idea. The room is incredible, the bed is plush, but the noise is insane! I'm going to be here with my sister until Monday (4 nights) and I could hear the people that moved into two rooms across the hall talk about a wedding they are going to/ members of. I can only imagine what the nights to come are going to be like! Luckily I have the 42" flat screen that I can turn up and drowned the chaos out! Neighbors might not like the noise, though. I'm a bit upset that I'm paying the same amount people will be paying in July when the restaurant, pool and hot tub are back open, after renovation. BTW excellent spread on the complimentary breakfast! All fresh, all tasty, and tables and real silverware, no plastic! I would recommend it, but with warning to bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside the downtown core”
Reviews.Author: MarkOlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Cloud Hotel on Broadway in late 2009. I found the hotel to be nice, clean and perfectly comfortable for a visit to Seattle. The rooms each had a microwave and refrigerator in a small kitchenette and a flat screen television with lots of public access, shopping and research channels but no premium (HBO, Showtime, etc.) channels. The rooms were very quiet and soundproof - no street or between room noises but I did find the heater to be distracting. I thought the bed was very comfy and the linens were high quality and new. The room included a buffet breakfast in the on-site Cayenne restaurant where you could make your own waffles with plenty of cereal, coffee, juice, yogurt, etc. or if you preferred you could go right next store to the IHOP. There was also a QFC (grocery store) just down the street . The hotel wasn't located downtown but there is a shuttle that goes to 4 or 5 downtown locations so you don't have to drive or take a taxi. There is street and underground parking for those driving. I flew into SEA and took the new Sound Link streetcar and then simply got on the hotel shuttle downtown for a total cost of only $2.50. The hotel is located on Broadway and Madison in the very safe First Hill section of Seattle which contains a lot of unique shops, restaurants and Seattle University. The hotel also had a pool and hot tube that I personally didn't use, a free (no quarters required) washer and dryer on each floor and 2 internet-enabled PC's in the lobby to check emails. I enjoyed my stay at the Silver Cloud Hotel. The front desk staff was very informative, professional and friendly, the rooms were quiet and modern, the area around the hotel had plenty to do and see day or night and I enjoyed breakfast. I would return and have recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: llanepdx
Reviews.Content: Came to Seattle with my high school Senior to visit Seattle University, I chose this hotel because it was adjacent to the campus. It seems exceptionally quiet - the large room is hushed in a soothing way, and even the elevators were quick and nearly silent. Comfortable beds, nice linens, easy internet access, two sinks, microwave and fridge, a Seattle Times hung on the door, nice continental breakfast in the restaurant. It did seem expensive - $149 for the room plus $16 to park - for a hotel outside of downtown. But was easy walking distance from the Seattle University's Lee Center for the Arts, where we saw a school musical, and from Annapurna Cafe on Broadway, where we had a interesting ("Himalayan"), tasty and inexpensive dinner. And from Seattle University's admissions office, where our scheduled visitor session and tour were held. While check-out time is noon, guests can leave their cars parked in the garage all day without additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: siouxsiesoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire.com, so we got a fantastic rate, and the Silver Cloud met our expectations just fine for a 3.5 star hotel. Check in was fast and curteous. There were apples and hard candy available at the front desk, which was a nice touch. We had a standard king room, and it suited us just fine. Very clean, with a nice large desk so I could do my school work when we weren't out and about. Nice flat screen TV, and a mini-fridge, microwave and small kitchenette sink. Nice room decor with granite counter tops. My only complaint about the room was that ours was pretty drafty: the window didn't shut all the way, so we had the heat on non-stop, and the sound coming from the door sounded like a wind tunnel. The complimentary continental breakfast was great! Make-your-own waffles, a large variety of pastries, toast, bagels, english muffins, cereal...and hard boiled eggs for protein! If you need something more substantial for breakfast, an IHOP is just next door. The location was nice as well...about a 10-15 minute walk to downtown shopping, and another 5 minutes to the waterfront. The hotel is in a decent neighborhood right near the University, and Pike Street two-blocks away had lots of eclectic shops, bars and restaurants that we hadn't been to on previous trips to Seattle. There's also a QFC grocery store on the corner for any incidentals. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Serene Oasis in midst of busy downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: alaska_rick
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several of the Silver Cloud Hotels in Seattle/Bellevue area and have not been disappointed with any of them. The Silver Cloud Broadway is another one that has proved to be a relaxing and peaceful place to stay. The rooms are in neutral tones and tastefully decorated.
