Granite counters and Large flat screen TV's make it feel up-to-date. The staff has consistently been professional and friendly. It really feels like a home away from home. I would highly recommend this hotel and have already recommended it to my own family. Great value for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel but not near the action.”
Reviews.Author: boingchicken
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud on Broadway was a perfectly adequate and clean hotel. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. My only complaint about it was that it's far from downtown. Overall it was an average hotel. Rooms were fairly sized but not huge. Everything was clean. I'd only stay there again if I wanted to be in that particular area in Seattle (near the University).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, neat neighborhood, very well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: Lillytravels
Reviews.Content: Very well maintained and clean hotel. I've stayed at a Silver Cloud hotel in Portland, and this one met my high expectations. I especially love the big bowl of candy in the lobby--always a nice touch. Staff were very helpful with maps and directions to area attractions, including neighborhood cafes and parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: hutchets
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Silver Cloud on Broadway. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when we asked for tips and information on the city. The bartender in the cayanne restaurant was just as helpful. The hotel was very, very clean and the housekeeping staff did a wonderful job. Shuttle service was right on. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service to improve absolutely”
Reviews.Author: PatriceYVR
Reviews.Content: During all my stay, I never met a valet parking nor a doorman. At the reception desk, the person didn't make an effort to understand me in English since I speak french. No smile, little service. At the check out, they wanted me to sign a document to accept to pay anything damaged in the room. But the receptionist didn't tell me that. It was nothing, just like a registration card. I refused. And they wanted me to pay by credit card the parking whereas I had said at my check in that I would pay in cash. At last and not the least, I heard a noise in my room due probably to the air conditioning although I had turned it off. The second night, it was disturbing. But the clerk didn't seem to be surprised. I would say it was clean, correct, the spa was not nice, under the parking. It was enough far from the downtown and the shuttle was delayed, more 15 minutes. It is enough expensive regarding the service. But it's correct to stay one or two days to be in the area. Check the problems as you check in. For the demanding people, the hotel is not worth its 3 stars. A big effort to make to be polite and courteous towards the foreigners mainly when they try to speak American. Sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: plclarkson
Reviews.Content: First time staying in a Silver Cloud Hotel ( frankly never heard of the chain) Very Very Very happy with the entire stay. Excellent service from Paul at the front desk. Nice room, Clean and comfortable. Perfect location. Very close to all Seallte attractions, but just outside. Great walking, very safe neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oetgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel a week before arriving. The second room was for my friend; we were disappointed that they did not put the two rooms together, but rather on two different floors. Our room was a quiet, corner room and was spacious, clean, and well-appointed. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. We used the work-out center in the mornings. Parking is beneath the hotel at $16/day with in-and-out privileges. The hotel provides a free shuttle service which makes various stops around tourist sites almost hourly. The walk downhill to Pikes Place is about 20 minutes. Breakfast is included in the price at the adjoining restaurant---it had a nice selection of fruits, cereals, juices, eggs, waffles, yogurt, etc. The restaurant itself was chic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just a few block from downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: nicadago
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, just a few block from downtown. They run a shuttle bus frequently to downtown which is great. Staff is very helpful. Complimentary breakfast is also good, especially the waffels.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business or Just to Visit”
Reviews.Author: xSnowcrashx
Reviews.Content: It was over 100 Degrees in Seattle and had to escape the heat. The hotel is nice, about 10 blocks from Downtown and walking distance to the Capitol Hill Nightlife. I highly recommend it. Places to visit nearby The Garage http://www.garagebilliards.com Great late night bowling/bar with surprisingly good food. Emerson Salon http://EmersonSalon.com if you need a quick haircut or color Check out http://chopsuey.com and http://neumos.com for concerts going on during your stay. Finally visit http://chapelseattle.com another great Seattle bar

Reviews.Title: “Needed hotel close to hospital”
Reviews.Author: dlapof
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice. I was having surgery at Swedish Hospital both times and needed a place to rest afterwards. Both visits were great. The first time I guess I might have been out of it somewhat but still the family really like it. While it might not be great for little kids it certainly is a very nice hotel and the staff was great. Restaurant is right down stairs and there are a number of close by placed that you can walk to. It’s about 10 blocks up the hill from Pike Place market. If you want to be close to down town but not right there this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_babygirl
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have ever been to a hotel with better staff. They were helpful, approachable and courteous. The free shuttle to downtown is a great help. Rooms are clean, large with good variety of amenities. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: VicGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Seattle Saturday afternoon via the Clipper. Things went smooth and we grabbed a cab right to the hotel. Check in was easy and quick. Because of a previous review we did request a room on the quiet side. We were given a room on the 4th floor at the end of the hall overlooking the restaurant. The room wasn't overly large, but very functional. There was a bar area with a sink, microwave and fridge. Nice bathroom with Aveda toiletries and a very comfortable king size bed. The breakfast was great with a selection of pastries and bagels, hardboiled eggs, yogurt, waffles and fruit. The hot tub area left a little to be desired, but it was still nice to have one available. Overall it was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great for family visits”
Reviews.Author: paleale33
Reviews.Content: We were in 606; the room was quiet and comfortable, the bathroom was squeaky clean, warm and well-lit. At every point, we were pleased with the service and the amenities. All staff members we encountered were helpful, professional and pleasant. We were in Seattle at the tail end of a longer trip, to visit family. The amenities were just what we needed. The breakfast offered a nice variety and aside from that there was a sweet treat - a waffle maker with fruit toppings. Newspapers and wireless internet access were available, in the room and at no extra cost. Also in the room was a microwave oven, a refrigerator, a small sink and counter (aside from the bathroom). Much of what we needed to do and see was within pleasant walking distance, but it's nice to know that a shuttle service was available. Laundry on each floor was very very welcome. All in all, this is not a luxury resort and maybe not the best place to be if one's purpose is taking in every one of Seattle's attractions, but for what we needed - a comfortable place to stay while visiting family - it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel had large, comfortable rooms with a fridge and microwave, plasma TV, outside-bathroom sink, chair, and desk. The room came with nice extras like free wireless internet and a generous breakfast. The location is a little far from downtown attractions, but they also have a free shuttle; we walked back, and it really is not a horrible walk, just a strenuous one because of the hills. I had a very comfortable stay and would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location, and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fiftyplusmale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary in one of the hotel's jacuzzi suites. We are both large persons and the tub was large enough for us. The surprise was the hotel restaurant, very good food and reasonable for Seattle. The complementary shuttle took us where we needed to go, one should tip though. Staff was pleasant and accomodating. The continental breakfast is deluxe, the waffles you cook yourself are good and there is a strawberry compote to put on in addition to syrup. Lots of fruits and breakfast goodies. The only drawback is that the hotel is next to the hospital, so ambulance sirens are loud. Bring a sound machine, and it works out well. The garage is tight for large vehicles, only a limited number of large vehicle spaces, so if you have a smaller vehicle,take it there. The parking is secure, the 16.00 a day charge is a little steep, but you'd pay that many times over if you moved your car around Seattle. Pool area looked nice but we didn't try it out. There is a QFC food store 3 blocks from the hotel, lots of ready to eat items sold there. Recommended ;we will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Genuinely Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunsunsun16
Reviews.Content: I will treasure my stay at the Silver Cloud forever. The staff were incredible. They were real people. The shuttle service was mind blowing; almost like having your own taxi service. Frequent, friendly, and personal. I parked my car and used it instead. Extra touches like a huge bowl of fresh fruit on the desk at all times, unlimited use of the business room, incredible sheets like I've only had in 5 star hotels. My room was ultra clean and comfortable. Absolutely soundproof from both other rooms and the street. I did ask for the side of the hotel away from the busy street. Microwave and fridge provided, as well as coffeemaker. The coffee, Tully's, was not good. I was sorry I hadn't brought my own. Lovely bathroom with nice fixtures and a fibreglass tub that felt warm. The best bed I've ever slept in. However, the maid ignored my big note to not bother making it up (I don't like hospital corners and hated the bedspread). She took the tip and made it up anyway. Great wide screen TV, clock radio, mood lighting. Very pleasant room, a small suite, really. Small couch and foot rest, a real desk. There is a very clean free laundry room with newer appliances. I'd messed up with one of my plans and the staff couldn't do enough to help me sort this out. They were genuinely kind. The free breakfast was lovely. An abundance of everything you could want: boiled eggs, toast, coffee, juices, yogurt, make your own waffles, fruit, several kinds of cereal and granola. Unfortunately, the restaurant in general is not recommended. I had a pulled pork sandwich that was not the real thing; more like a shredded pork chop. A spinach/artichoke dip with barely any artichokes. Excellent service, but the food was not up to par and overpriced for what you got. I went out to eat or used my microwave most of the time. Disappointing: no bellhops. I hauled my luggage upstairs myself with a cart. Though the desk clerk did say the maintenance guy would help if I wanted. I thought this was odd. The hot tub was nice, but the pool was too cold. There were no private showers or change rooms, so you had to leave damp and shower again in your room. The entire area was cold, including an icy fitness room. Other guests found it so, as well. Having to walk through the parking garage (even passing a street entrance) to get to it was weird, too. Overall, though, it was like staying at a B&B but with a lot more privacy. I left feeling very good. But they need to do something about the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Spokane_WATraveler
Reviews.Content: Close proximity to Seattle Univ. caused us to stay at the Silver Cloud. Loved the large comfortable room with microwave, frig and large bathtub. Free wireless internet. Free shuttle to downtown for shopping and dinner saved us the hassle of driving and parking. Fire alarm at 3am was not terrific but they handled it well and we were back in our room within a few minutes (after the fire department ok'd it!). I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerNevada
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel for it's location to Seattle University. A lovely safe hotel, nicely appointed with Aveda products. Really fluffy towels and comfy bed and pillows. Only drawback is front facing rooms on Broadway have siren noise from hospital down the block. Ask for a room off of Broadway if you want quiet. Breakfast was good with premium coffees/teas/hot choc. they offer hard boiled eggs for those that want protein and not just carbs. Always lots of apples at front desk to grab on way in and out of hotel. Security was great with room key needed to access floors/garage during late hours. Front desk staff very friendly, extremely clean rooms & common areas. Easy to get to & from Fwy. Charge for parking garage ($16) but secured lot & lots of parking. I felt it was a fair charge. Did not use shuttle service but saw others utilizing it. Would definitely stay at this location or chain again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place where the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Kellygobraugh
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud Broadway was a great place to stay during our 2-day visit to Seattle. The staff was friendly and provided good directions and tips on things to do around town. There is a good free breakfast at the restaurant next door and fresh fruit is available at the front desk for free all day. Our room was spacious, with a view of the community outside. There was a little fridge and the bathroom was large. The rooms were very clean and well-maintained. Though, there is not much going on in the neighborhood, the hotel is a short walk from some restaurants. Nearby is a friendly gay area of town with some cute shops and cafes that were occupied by gay and straight clients. If you don't mind walking for 15-20 minutes, the city center is a pleasant walk. We really enjoyed walking around Seattle. But, if you are not inclined to walk, the hotel has a free shuttle service which we did not use. The hotel has parking, a pool and hot tub. No complaints on this hotel. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great week at the Silver Cloud - loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MarylandLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: Silver Cloud Broadway is a very nice hotel! The rooms were great, beds comfortable, bathroom very clean. The little fridge, sink and microwave in the room were a nice convenience. A grocery store is just down the block. The breakfast was delicious every morning -so many choices!! I was stuffed each day. The location is pretty good, about a 10 minute walk to the convention center. Buses in Seattle are pretty easy to figure out also. The fitness center is small, but good for a quick AM workout. The pool was a bit chilly, but also good. I would definitely come back here again and recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: SmallTownMom
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12 year old son and I went to Seattle for the weekend to have fun. We stayed three nights at the S.C. on Broadway. It is a bit out of walking distance of the downtown attractions but the complimentary shuttle is easy to use. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the decor was upscale from the box hotels. The rates were the same as the Holiday Inn or Travelodge but the feel was more elegant. The breakfast buffet is pretty basic; cereal, bagels, waffles; that type of stuff. We paid for parking in the underground garage but that's standard in the downtown area. The room was your basic two queens room with a comfy reading chair and ottoman and a well appointed desk. We were able to use wireless internet with our laptop for no additional fee. There is a large flat screen tv which is much nicer than a typical unit that takes a lot of space. The small things were nice; the hangers come off the rod. The towels are softer than your usual box hotel. There is a complimentary laundry room on each floor. The beds were super comfy. We didn't use the pool and spa but the area was clean. I used the small gym; it was unremarkable but does have a tv. We ordered dinner from room service (from the Cayenne Grille downstairs) and it was prompt and yummy. My Captain and Coke was just right and a at good price. We'll definitely stay again. I'm not sure what it is about the S.C.; it's not a remarkable hotel in any one area but the atmosphere and staff make you feel comfortable and just a bit pampered. Our son loved the hotel and highly recommends it, also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sundinkc
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Silver Cloud Hotel on Broadway at Madison. Having lived in the neighborhood before moving away, we didn't know what to expect from this hotel in a neighborhood underserved by hotels. We were very pleased with our stay. Our room, located on the top of six floors was of decent size with a king size bed. The wall-mounted flat screen TV was great. Although we didn't use it, the hotel has a pool and fitness center in the basement. Also included with the rate is a continental breakfast which we never saw as we had morning meetings during the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: PJTravels
Reviews.Content: We found this an excellent base for a few days of touring. Hotel staff were great, room was large and comfortable, with a large bar area for arranging refreshments. (Also a convenient grocery store about two blocks away for stocking your fridge.) Breakfast in adjacent restaurant was fine, we were directed to an excellent restaurant a few blocks away for dinner, and there are casual college-neighborhood eating places nearby on Broadway. What was unbeatable, however, was the combination of free breakfast, free internet, free parking in the garage, and a free shuttle service to take you to and from the most popular tourist points in town.

Reviews.Title: “silver cloud with gold service”
Reviews.Author: drewomite
Reviews.Content: Great stay in Seattle. This was the first hotel room we ever booked on Hotwire.com. To our surprise the room and service exceeded our expectations. The room was huge with two large beds, wet bar, refrigerator and a 42" flat screen t.v. What surprised us the most however was the personal service. The front desk staff was great. They recommended restaurants and took time to ask how our day was when we returned to the hotel. Little things like the free shuttle, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and fresh apples in the lobby were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: globegurl
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! We only stayed one night because we were headed up to Canada but the one night was VERY comfortable. The night we arrived the french door in our room had gotten off its track so the room was pretty chilly. We called the front desk about it and they came up and showed us to a new room immediately. The continental breakfast was also very tasty with lots of variety. My boyfriend and I noticed a lot of younger folks staying there- maybe it's because it has a sort of hip feel to it. This hotel was also very close to downtown seattle- we walked downtown in 10 minutes. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the budget-concious”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne&Laine
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via an auction site and while it was represented as a 3.5 star (out of possible 4 stars for Seattle), I feel that is being overly generous. While the place is very clean and the front desk staff are lovely and helpful, it really is geared to the very budget-concious traveller and I would barely give it 3 stars. The location is the most remote of all downtown hotels on the city map (it's on the other side of the highway where most other hotels are situated between I-5 and the waterfront) and there was really nothing of interest to us in the vicinity of the hotel since we don't hang out at hospitals. This really brings down the value of the hotel, to my mind. The included breakfast was headache-inducing as there are not nearly enough staff to service the area. We, and many other people, ended up spending the majority of our time in the restaurant standing around waiting for things like cutlery, coffee, etc. The rooms are clean and our room was relatively quiet and the huge flatscreen tvs are great. We also appreciated the shuttle service to the actual downtown area. We would not stay here again (or ever use an auction site to book a room again to avoid this situation) but I would definitely recommend this to budget concious travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cbcotraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value in Seattle. My husband and I were there for a wedding in June of 2007. We had original plans to stay at the Warwick. We were meeting my in laws and they had already checked into the Warwick and hated it. They found the Silver Cloud in Capital Hill. The public transportation (bus stop) is right at the corner of the hotel so it was really easy to get to shopping and Pike Place. When we checked in, the hotel did not have a standard room with a king bed so they upgraded us at no charge to the corner suite. It had a jacuzzi tub with a fireplace! Wonderful! The staff was very nice and helpful. They even called to place our dinner reservations. There is a complimentary breakfast every morning in the restaurant- delicious! Highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A budget, mini-W!”
Reviews.Author: twigtwig
Reviews.Content: A GREAT bang for the buck! We paid $159/nt. [I say mini-W because the lobby was pretty cool like the W's - complete w/a dark wood bowl of granny smiths to munch on, and mod-decor (albeit lighter than the W).] We were in town for my sister's wedding a whopping 1/2 mi. away - very convenient for us. Also close to Trader Joe's - a must-visit novelty for us when we come to Seattle - we're not blessed w/one where we live. FAB front desk staff - I mean ON it! CLEAN (!!) rooms w/comfy beds/bedding! Rooms were a bit small, but sufficient. Breakfast was tasty and just right - not to mention a wise use of their night-time restaurant/bar, which looked like it would be fun in the evening. Pool was clean, lovely and secluded (no gawking, or feeling like you were on display - I swim to exercise) - NICE! Parking was convenient, safe and well-concealed (not an eyesore). A little bit o' bad: Stayed in room on 5th floor facing front door / main entrance / street / courtyard. All I'm going to say is that the builder pulled a fast one on these folks when they purchased those super-duper cool slider/window things. They look double-paned and noise-proof-esque, but holy cow.... I could hear (literally) a man's whistling as he was walking down the sidewalk in front of the hotel... on the other side of the street! Suffice to say, you could hear everything else too. Got woken up often during the nights that we stayed. Would definitely stay here again, but will request room in different location to see if the noise situation would be improved. I hope so, because everything else was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: monkey769
Reviews.Content: Silver Cloud had a fantastic front desk staff - very welcoming, friendlly, and humorous. The hotel itself is what you'd expect from a 3 star hotel -- no incredible amenities, but everything was clean and in working order. It was fairly accessible to most Settle sites and provided a good central location for walking points around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on Capitol hill”
Reviews.Author: AprilMayJune25
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed at this hotel every time we visit Seattle. It is close to our favorite shops and restaurants on Broadway. Not to mention hip bars up and down the cross streets. The hotel itself is clean, comfy and the staff is always pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone looking for a decent hotel in a fun area. Downtown is a short walk or bus ride down the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ed30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and also after doing some research on the area. The hotel is cheaper to stay in if you book through a hotel site. Value for money though, a 3 star hotel that is succeeding in being a 4 star hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are a good size and clean. The breakfasts are really good, good choice. Great location for local bars and restaurants (check out Kingfish Cafeat 19th and Mercer, Fantastic southern food!). Good local and student area full of real people and not tourists. Can e noisy at times with the Hospital but thats a small thing to put up with. Would definately stay here again. Stayed an extra 3 nights. Check out Victrola Coffee on Pike St as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alison T
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late at night from the east coast and were greeted warmly by the front desk. The room was large and very comfortable and the bathroom was huge. There was free internet access beside the lobby. The complimentary breakfast was good. The indoor pool was also nice. The courtesy shuttle bus was a useful addition. All in all, a very pleasant stay, and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paulandsarahthomas
Reviews.Content: They really thought of everything -- good breakfast, free laundry, clean and comfortable beds, workout and computer area, real newspaper in the mornings. Friendly staff. Location was good. Try the Garage restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mightyquinn5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great neighbourhood. There are coffee shops & other stores down the street. It feels safe at night. You could walk to all the attractions and sights and shops downtown in a few minutes downhill. They also had a free shuttle service that would take you downhill & pick you up. The hotel itself was very nice and new. The rooms were quite large and nicely decorated & clean. The staff were extremely nice as well! The continental breakfast was great, they had lots of options, even oatmeal and boiled eggs. They also had apples in the front lobby and very nice areas to relax. Some of the more expensive hotels we passed downtown seemed to be in areas that weren't so safe at night. I would stay at this hotel again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: chicks13
Reviews.Content: NIce place to stay. Has a indoor pool for the kids to swim. Very friendly staff. Courtesy shuttle to downtown. Comfortable beds. Great restaurant on location! Free use of washer and dryer on each floor. Walking distance to shops and places to eat. Affordable prices for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem!”
Reviews.Author: amynielsens
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable everywhere…. - The hotel lobby that has many chairs, tables, and fireplace which is inviting to sit & relax or visit with your friends/family. - The attached restaurant bar is clean, bright, and has plenty of seats so you can enjoy a special drink. - The rooms are large, the beds/bedding are first class (note they still use bedspreads which I promptly removed). - The bathroom has plenty of light and great water pressure. - Oh yes…complimentary wireless internet through out the hotel! Our next trip to Seattle will find us staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, best choice”
Reviews.Author: cjindc
Reviews.Content: I looked at the other hotels near the hospital, and some are pretty nice, but asked at the hospital and one staffer recommend this one above the others - and she was so right! It was closest to the maternity area of the hospital, they had free laundry machines, VERY Clean and Comfortable rooms. The bed was great, the decor was wonderful, very spacious, and quiet. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and that same restaurant is great all day long. They were less expensive than the other hotels in the area, but I don't think I could have enjoyed any place more, and I usually enjoy the posh hotels. This one even had a nice bar area in the room for heating up leftovers, nice sized fridge, sink and granite counter top. The gym could have been nicer - I prefer the equipment with built in TV screens and a room with more color. The fitness room had some cardio machines and that was all that I noticed, along with the pool -they were separated by glass walls. All this is an underground extension of the basement parking, so not much charm or color -a little attention to add color to the walls, or something to make it more inviting would be a huge improvement for little effort. But the basic necessities were there and had promise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: luluvision
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Broadway for 4 days in mid-October. We thought it was great! Our room had a king size bed with a microwave oven and frig. We had our laptop and the internet connection worked great. We thought the pressure in the shower was awesome and the curtains kept the light from coming in so it was super dark in the morning, which we like. It's little things like that that make a big difference. We didn't hear any of our neighbors (we later traveled to 2 other locations and stayed in cheaper hotels where we could hear everything.) The breakfast was fine. The first day there weren't any eggs but everytime afterwards, there were hard boiled eggs. The coffee was delicious and the waffle maker was fun. They had the other usual things, bagels, danishes, yogurt, fruit and juice. We didn't rent a car and had to rely on the buses. The front desk couldn't provide too much assistance on the buses. The shuttle van is good for downtown locations only and the driver was very friendly. I would recommend this place to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with many conviences!”
Reviews.Author: Him8ns
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located about 1 mile from downtown Seattle. My daughter is attending Seattle University and the hotel is right across the street. It is 2 years old, very clean, and spacious. They include a deluxe continental breakfast with make your own waffles. No breakfast meats or eggs, but enough to fill you up. IHOP is right next door if you want a heavy breakfast. This hotel offers so many conviences that I would stay here again over being in downtown like I normally stay. They have a large shuttle bus that holds 14 passengers that leaves the hotel every 30 minutes to drop you off to places like the wharf, Pike's market, downtown, and even to Qwest field for the Seahawks game. They will also pick you up when you call them up to at least 10pm. They have a complimentary laundry area, business center with printer (very convenient for Web check-ins), coffee in the lobby and a big screen TV in the lobby and lounge area to relax. The staff and drivers are very friendly and helpful. They offer discounts to Seattle U parents. Parking is $14 a day. I was very happy staying here!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: teacupmama
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Seattle. The rooms were very comfortable and larger than we are used to in San Diego. A fridge and microwave was a real plus. The beds were the most comfortable! The continental breakfast was great! The lobby was nice and had coffee and tea at all times of the day. The hotel is not in the downtown area which was fine with me as it was quiet for sleeping. Very convenient to catch a cab or a shuttle to the Pikes Place, Needle, Aquarium, etc.. I usually have a problem sleeping in a hotel the first night but not here. I was delighted. I only wish our stay was longer here. I will most certainly stay here again. The price was very reasonable for all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: iamathew
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for a wedding. In addition to my family of four, my extended family took up at least 6 more rooms. We had a room with two queen beds and there was plenty of space for us and our children (ages 11 & 3). The room was clean and having a microwave and refrigerator in our room was great for the kids. It was also very easy to get around in the hotel. I didn't have to worry about my 11 year old getting lost trying to run back up to our room to get something. The staff was terrific and friendly. The shuttle service was a great way to get around to the fun places without a car and the shuttle drivers were super friendly (particularly Monica). We were able to get everywhere we had wanted to go using the shuttle. It was also nice to have free internet access down in the lobby. The breakfast was convenient and my kids loved making their own waffles! The food at Cayenne was fine and the people who worked there were really friendly. The only complaint I have for our entire trip was Cayenne's inability to divide checks at least by table (I understand not wanting to manage 20 single person checks). However, making us do the work of working out payment from 20 people was more frustrating to us than it would have been for them to divide the group in to the four tables we took up. This was the only not-customer oriented experience we had on our trip. I would suggest they change that policy and I'm also guessing that their tips would be better broken out in to smaller checks. Other than that, it was our first trip to Seattle and we had a wonderful time. We will definately stay at the Silver Cloud Hotel again. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle on a lovely trip with my two kids. We had never heard of SIlver Cloud Hotels before this stay, I have to say that I will stay with them again. The front desk was so great and helpful that I felt as if I knew them by the second night of my stay there. The Indoor Pool and Spa was such a great way to have the kids end their day. The earth tones that are found throughout the hotel was wonderful and made us all feel right at home. This hotel only being 2 years old is a wonderful place for anyone to stay. I would recommend it to anyone that is coming to the Seattle Area. I want to thank all staff for making my and my childrens stay wonderful in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and 2 of our friends stayed overnight on May 27th at the Silver Cloud on Broadway the night before our cruise ship sailed. We stayed on June 4th for an extra day in Seattle on the back end of the cruise too. The staff was very helpful and let us put all our luggage out in the back after checking out on May 28th so we could do some sightseeing in the morning before boarding our ship. Then on Sunday the 4th, we disembarked pretty early from our ship but were able to check right in as they had a room available. The beds were VERY comfortable and linens were soft and smooth. We took advantage of the shuttle to various downtown areas to do some sightseeing both times. The staff was very helpful with recommendations and calling various transportation to get us to the port. We really enjoyed the fire that was lit in the fireplace as it was a bit cool outside. The glass slider doors could use some weather sealing or something in both the rooms we used, since there were significant air leaks. The door came right off the track when trying to open it in one room! I'd still stay there again though as it was very clean and the breakfast was great! They even had a protein choice - lots of hard boiled eggs! Not to mention Tully's coffee. VERY good!

Reviews.Title: “O.K. But Short on Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a week. It looks like a nicer hotel than it is. On the plus side, the room are of good size, well appointed, and nice. The indoor pool is nice. The continental breakfast is more than just a few danish selections and coffee. The lobby is very nice. Now, as to the issues that annoyed me: 1. There is no bell captain to help you on arrival. It looks like a hotel that would have this service, so one is disappointed when you have to lug the luggage yourself. 2. There is a lady who sits at a desk that looks like she may be a concierge, but I'm not sure as she also looks like a secretary that has been misplaced from the office suite. She is not very friendly, not very helpful, and not worth tipping. 3. The restaurant Cyanne has an ecletic menu and a nice setting, but the staff is wholly untrained and just a mess. Horrible!!! They are nice, but incompetent.l. The food is average at best, and if you're just too tired to move outside to Broadway and get a decent meal, it will pass. Reminds me of Denny's food...that's where you settle. 4. The garage is tiny, and do not rent or take a big car like I did. The turns are extremely tight, and the parking places are made for mini-coopers. At $14 a night, it seems that they should pay you hazard pay to drive there. Also, there is no valet to park your car. Again, the hotel is set up to have a valet but no valet. 5. I had a rate of $124 a night, and though this is a good rate, along with added taxes and parking it was not outlandish, but I would have paid a little more for a little more class. It looks like you are going to get a great hotel, and then it just doesn't show up. 6. I will probably stay there again, but this time I will come in with lower expectations and be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Annyka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Cloud on Broadway for a 2 night business trip just this past week. It was great! The bed was very comfortable, great food in the Cayenne Restaurant/Bar and the shuttle runs approximately every 30 minutes and takes you downtown or to the waterfront. The room was very nice and it had a small microwave and small fridge, desk with internet access, TV, king sized bed, chaise lounge chair and separate bar area with small fridge. There is a 24 hour tea and coffee (Tulley's coffee) bar in the hotel lobby. The hotel had several places to eat with easy walking distance and a Starbuck's, Tulley's coffee, QFC grocery store all near by. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes this a Great stay”
Reviews.Author: FernandoBee
Reviews.Content: Forget about the rooms do not have wireless internet service. All of the front desk staff are truly professional. Rooms were very clean and well appointed. The garage had plenty of parking on a Saturday night. The continental breakfast at Cayenne Restaurant was adequate. I will return again.

HotelInfo.Name: Silver Cloud Hotel - Broadway
HotelInfo.Address: 1100 Broadway, Seattle, WA 98122
